title.rendered: IPL 2023: List of injured players and their replacement status

content.rendered:
Jasprit Bumrah is a top-level cricketer going to miss IPL 2023. He recently had surgery and will be out of action for a while. Along with Bumrah, Rishabh Pant is also a big name who will miss the tournament. The Delhi Capitals cricketer was involved in an accident a few months ago and the player is still on the mend. In both cases, the teams are yet to have to name a replacement. Prasidh Krishna, Jhye Richardson, Kyle Jamieson, and Will Jacks are the remaining players who will not play in IPL 2023. (Read Also: The Entire schedule of IPL 2023)

Prasidh Krishna is suffering from a stress fracture injury. Jhye Richardson has got a hamstring injury in BBL. So both are not available for the IPL 2023. Kyle Jamieson has a back stress fracture. Will Jackshas was injured during the Bangladesh tour?

So far, RCB is the only franchise to have announced a replacement for its injured cricketer. They have signed Michael Bracewell to replace the English cricketer.

An exciting season is beginning with us, every IPL T20 Season promises to be exciting, and IPL 2023 is no different. This time, the dynamic of the “impact player” rule also comes into a hit which would change the tactics and strategies of the franchises.

Check out the list given below:

1. Jasprit Bumrah (MI) – replacement is not confirmed yet

2. Rishabh Pant (DC) – Replacement is not confirmed yet

3. Prasidh Krishna (RR) – Replacement is not confirmed yet

4. Kyle Jamieson (CSK) – Sisanda Magala

5. Will Jacks (RCB) – Michael Bracewell

6. Jhye Richardson (MI) – Replacement is not confirmed yet

Last season, was the first edition following the mega auction. Teams may not have had enough time to correct mistakes they made on the auction table.

However, the franchise companies have now prepared well and so we can expect a tight season this time.
